1_1BFTNXtYQDMCurqyg45KLmsV6oJD7bQSsH.body:
> [nofish](#comment_706_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): It's usually happens if for some reasons one of the users files does not get propagated around the network correctly (often caused by unstable network connection).You can check which files is problematic on the site's sidebar. (drag topright button to left)The site owner able to fix this errors by signing the user's file using the site's privatekey. (just did, so press an update on the site and the error should be gone)

Ty

> [tkarita](#comment_23_1GervYZoP82e8X1Rgc4wyMkJY2zSsJuq8t): The ZeroTalk interface has some usability problems.  The link to edit your own posts is a faint pencil icon about the size of a mouse pointer, and is invisible until you mouse over the left margin next to the first line below your username.  It should be textual and at least as visible as the "reply" link.

the pencil icon appears to edit the image, only the texts.

> [tkarita](#comment_25_1GervYZoP82e8X1Rgc4wyMkJY2zSsJuq8t): When you edit a comment, you can choose to delete it... but the "delete" link is also invisible until you mouse over the blank space between "save" and "cancel".

Deleted the image more does not make much difference =/

> [tkarita](#comment_31_1GervYZoP82e8X1Rgc4wyMkJY2zSsJuq8t): It looks like you have to overwrite "COVER.jpg".  Try adding a comment there, and attach any smaller image with exactly that name.  If you upload something that isn't really an image, COVER.jpg might be deleted.

So far the adm scratch torrent has not contacted to increase the limit, does not help bring a torrent site without the owner ahead. He created the site and left it.

4_19sggoAZ4hcorrrfWoFWP9rwfpVsL29cnZ.body:
> [testset](#comment_17_17VwZEfWSUWb5RHkK9m1odnDdBfvjTL6Cp): Sineryc is right there are several Zites for torrent sharing on ZeroNet, but they are not good enough. 
> Play is only for movies and it lacks the possibility of user contribution. 
> TV episodes is only for series, it lacks lacks the possibility of user contribution and a good search function. 
> ZeroTorrent has the possibility of user contribution and a search function, but it is clumsy. It is quite clear that it was cloned from a Zite that was designed for something else. It also lacks some automatic generation of magnet links like that of TV episodes. 
> So I agree: it would be really cool if someone designed a Zite for torrent sharing that has all the good features but not the bad ones of the already existing Zites.

I know all these sites = D ty, I talk you should have a torrent site with all categories in general (the adm follow the site) believe the adm of zerotorrent left the site to time = / if the posting limit reached for me, it will come to a lot of people there is more difficult to upload.

> [cannonfodder](#comment_30_1GCMDNMgJHvZJfdbD9ygDmpBdnVAobdJYg): My plan for tvepisodes.bit is to work on:
> 
> Search. I have most of the kat magnet hash list in a database. The site currently only pulls TV for the past two weeks from this. I want to enable search for the rest.
> Make it look nicer.
> Add .torrent files.
> Enable commenting/user accounts.
> 
> User contribution of torrents is more difficult as it has overhead to check if they are valid.

If all goes well that his plan for the site there will is very cool! I miss to button to search and a nicer interface =D

7_19sggoAZ4hcorrrfWoFWP9rwfpVsL29cnZ.body:
> [genericusername](#comment_7_14ng1wByxwoNXAhihYbpgyarVJbFiqs8ny): Site admin here; There's still a lot of work to be done before we can get something that's really usable and anywhere near as good as what KickAssTorrents was. Any developers can grab the source code from Gitlab.
> Everyone else I'd be happy to answer any questions or concerns. You can also mail me here as well if you'd like.
> Mainly I'm interested in the sort of things you'd like to see from a torrent site on ZeroNet and what should and should not be included.

Could have an upload rank, more categories, put torrent cover the topic, so it becomes easier to know that torrent and that. I'm putting faith in your project. =D

CATEGORIES:

1 - Movie
2 - Games
3 - Séries
4 - Anime
5 - Porn
6 - Music
7 - Book
8 - Program
9 - Others

> [tkarita](#comment_83_1GervYZoP82e8X1Rgc4wyMkJY2zSsJuq8t): The quota is controlled by max_size entries in data/users/content.json.  Nobody seems to have good intuition for how large it should be: even in the chat rooms people reach the limits (erkan deleted his history to post again); in ZeroTorrent 2MB isn't large enough to accommodate uploaded files (interrupting sirenyc); in ZeroTalk the default limit can easily be reached in about a week (as bot and I have done).

I have this limit problem in zero torrent.

When I want to change the user I'm changing the (user.json) file in the folder.

> [beelzebub](#comment_3_13Cqt2MSFS6eu4cbVuByZBuULrEAcZAqFG): Hi, ZeroTorrent creator here.  My apologies for absence but been really busy.  My current dev version of zerotorrent has some bugs that need resolving (and i'm procrastinating) relating to optional_files improvements so it should scale better.  At the same time i'm trying to rope in some designers to help with the interface.
> A couple of pain points:
> 
> Lack of database migrations (think south/django).  There is already data in two formats on ZeroTorrent.
> Lack of proper sanitization of user data (can be done in coffescript/js but there is nothing to stop people running modified script or creating the json data files manually containing malicious js; the solution to this might be to sanitize on read).
> Difficult to prevent spam without moderation or it being a general pain in the ass (I have been thinking of doing some kind of POW like bitmessage to post, and clients could ignore posts without enough work,in theory this can be done in javascript)
> Difficult to (reliably) setup a testing environment with real data, without fucking up prod site. 
> 
> I have also been anticipating the merger sites feature and I am taking a look to see how it could be used to further help scaleability.
> If I can take a couple of weeks out I will evaluate all this and am considering starting from scratch and doing things less hacky this time (which would involve launching on a new address; the .bit would be updated, but we again fall on the issue of migrating user data, unless i create a single user to reupload everything currently on zerotorrent but comments will be tricky and attriution will be lost).
> I am lurking around from time to time and I hear your calls for ebooks section and I promise to include this on the next update, however, as mentioned, reliably testing is a bit of a bitch and I am quite apprehensive about touching the live site as I have previously fucked it up due to database migration (change of schema) issues. 
> Need to get moving on this ........ 
> Btw, not beelzebub.

To make it easier for everyone, should start from scratch, the gang helps upload again, ta missing a cleaner version of torrent sites!

I think Maelstrom concept is good.  \I still have questions about Zeronet though and wish that I could get answers.  I don't know how to upload a website, or mirror a website or any of that.. 
> What would be cool is an answer and a way to do it so that I don't just throw up my hands and say "forget it".

> [testingzeronet12](#comment_124_1CMjV2r4EBpFt8VCcWWZKDysZXPcPExRNN): I agree. A CMS system like Wordpress would be great if it was a standard tool included with ZeroNet. This woul make the creation of visually spectacular websites easy to do even for non-coders. This will really boost ZeroNet uptake IMHO. Nofish himself said in the Decentralised Web Summit that the thing he wants most if people to start creating websites and contributing to the ecosystem:
> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PfWgin3JlAU&feature=youtu.be&t=11002

If it was an easier system of creation, would try to put a project forward! Let's wait.

there is no way, no admin appears.

> [edantes](#comment_16_1JF3eQjW4voiKdcvCkMXvUx5bLmZAiVdyi): Yeah, maybe he felt he was out of his depth and quietly quit....if he gave up on the whole thing he should have at least let us know. So if that is indeed how it is then we're back to square one. Namely, sitting on an ever-growing index of torrents with nowhere stable to dump em. And with all this back-and-forth hubs business thats going on I'm not even sure if a manageable index site is viable yet, there needs to be at least one hub per category and there are going to be at least 8 or so, right? TV, Movies, Software, Music, Anime, Books/Magazines/Comics, XXX, Mobile Apps....and that is without any sub-categories, not to mention the community hubs. The whole thing really needs to be nailed down tight before the mass-uploading can begin because believe me, its going to take a fair while to upload tens of MILLIONS of torrents on a decentralized network such as this, you need to be sure you're doing it right.

I agree with you!
